name: places/ChIJGdbR2B9awokRG622mU6-ZT4
formattedAddress: 100 Hudson St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 100 Hudson St, New York, NY 10013, USA

editorialSummary.text: The renowned designer's flagship store showcasing his high-end, bespoke men's suits & separates.

originalText.text:
Thom Browne has something for everyone - whatever your body type and aesthetic, the folks here will work with you. Tailoring may well be among the finest in the world üôÇ All of this culminates in a price point that highlights (IMO) their deep love and passion for making you look impeccable.

The locations function like an atelier. A valuable consequence is that style and tailoring experts will spend hours with you to help find exactly what you need, with zero pressure to purchase anything.

My partner and I worked closely with Aditya, Isaac, and Dwayne. I would urge you to keep an open mind and ask questions to grow from their knowledge, experience, and passion.

Thom Browne is the atelier of love. Soak it in ‚ù§Ô∏è

originalText.text: Possibly RACIST and DEFINITELY BAD Customer Service and experience. Never calls back and only give you ran around. No response with complaint. Make sure you call them and text them otherwise they won‚Äôt give you your clothes. Horrible! The online team always tells you that they are gonna call u back and give you a resolution but never!!!!! AVOID

originalText.text: Fantastic, welcoming and knowledgeable staff. The store is minimalist and has a small variety of Thom Browne's collection. Never did I ever feel pressured to purchase anything (in the three or so times I've visited), which is hard to say of other luxury brands/fashion houses I've visited. You can see the quality the brand places behind it's products. I also don't feel like a walking ad wearing the product due to the subdued nature of branding on the pieces themselves. Talking to my advisor at the boutique feels natural, like a conversation with a friend. Thank you Aditya and the rest of the team who has assisted me in making my first few purchases/online pick-ups pleasant experiences.

originalText.text:
Had an awful experience.
They made me feel as if I were a credit card scammer, beacuse I forgot my wallet in my car so I asked if I could use my apple pay. I was upset they made me feel that type of way by bringing of credit card scamming quite a few times.

So I ended going back to my car grabbing my wallet . Came back to the store gave them my drivers id and credit card and for some reason the guy helping me takes my credit card and drivers id and brings it to the back . They definitely made a copy of both my cards .

Im not worried that the made copies of my cards beacuse I have nothing to hide just upset they(nyc thom brown employees) treat certain people different just beacuse of the way they dress look or speak .

I shop a lot at high end places this has to be the worst customer service I have ever received.

I still ended up buying a thom brown sweatsuit because the brands great, but the people working their are not! They definitely need to be checked !
